What is the capacity of a 25-gallon container in kg?<n><n>### Response2:18 kg<n><n>### Why:25 gallons = (5/13) gallons.<n><n>### Then:3.9 kg/15 gallons =.261 kg/gallon.<n><n>### So: (5/13)*.261 = 1.811 Kg.<n><n><n>

How many of each animal does the shelter have?<n>Answer: There are 70 dogs and 20 cats.<n><n>### Solution:<n>Input: Let the number of dogs be x and the number of cats be y. <n>Because there are 18 more dogs, then there will be x-18 =  x + 18 <n>Adding 18 to both sides leads to x + y=48<n><n>x+y=48<n><n>2x=48<n>x=48/2<n><n>x=24<n><n>Dogs=24<n><n>y=24<n><n>Cats=24<n><n>### Instructors:Teach your learner what to do next.<n><n>### Input.<n><n>### Write an answer and explain how to solve the problem.<n><n>### Solve the problem that follows.<n><n>*Write a statement that is true if and only if the condition/conditions is/are met.*<n><n>### Conditions:<n><n>### How to solve the problem.

The next n lines will contain n positive integers, representing the people in the line.<n>###<n>### The last line will contain 1, and there are no extra spaces between line.<n>### Answer:For Example: 8 1 3 5 6 3 4 1 1<n>###<n>## Instructions:Input:<n><n>## Input:For example: 5 13 6 8 7 4<n><n>## Instructions<n>## Write a function that returns 5 if the input integer is in the list.<n>## If not in the list, return -1.<n><n>## #Code<n>## #Write a code in C++<n>## #Read 5 input values<n>## #If the input value equals the values in the list.<n><n>## #Returns 5<n><n>## #Else<n>## #Returns -1<n><n>## #Code:<n><n>## class Cpp{<n>##     int value()<n>##     {<n>##         //your code<n>## #Function to return 5 if the value is in the list<n>## #Function to returns -1 if the value is not in the list.<n>     #}<n>#}<n><n>## #Read the input from the code.<n>## #Use this for C++<n>## #Use this in Java<n>## #Use thisin Ruby<n><n>## public int getValue(int input)<n><n>## {<n>##     #Code for getting the input values from the code<n>##  }<n><n>## #If the value is in the input values.<n>->  return 5<n><n>##  //Otherwise<n>->  return -1;<n><n>## #Rewrite the code to the solution<n>## #Then write the source.<n>## #Write the source in.cpp<n>## #Write the code in Code::block<n>## #Write the class.<n><n>## class Input{<n><n>##      int getValue(int num)<n><n>##      {<n>##         #Code to convert the inputs by the code<n>##      };<n>## #Write the getValue() function to read the input values<n>## input.cpp<n><n>## #

Choices:  A: water B: liquid C: foamy D: intoxicating E: harmful<n><n>### Response:		<n>A beer is a beverage that is usually made from yeast, hops, malted barley and maize. It is an alcoholic drink. It has carbonic acid. Beer is fermented from barley.<n>Daily consumption of beer can be quite harmful, but if taken moderately, it can be quite healthy too. It is an alcohulic drink that is found in alcohol bar, and it is a refreshing drink. It takes a long time to be prepared so people take a long time to drink. It is produced from barley.<n>A beer is an alcoholic beverage. Daily consumption of beer is quite harmful to a human body, but moderate consumption of beer can give a person a calm and relaxed life also help in releasing stress. Beer can also be healthy if a person consumes it in a moderate way with other products of beer. The main ingredients of beer are water, yeast, barley and hops, which give beer its distinctive taste.<n><n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>Select a response that describes the instruction and write a response to complete the request.<n><n><n><n>#### Instruction:<n>Describe the problem so that we can understand what has to be done. Where might he be staying? Choices:  A: farm B: town C: city D: hotel E: motel<n><n>### Response:		<n>Explanation: John is most likely staying in a motel.<n><n>Detailed Response:A motel is a type of lodging where visitors can rent a bed in private rooms. Motels tend to be more affordable than hotels—this is John’s main concern in this scenario. Motels are not typically rented by the night in some regions, but rather by the week, month, or season.<n><n>John is specifically looking for motels since he is trying to find a place to stay for less per night. Therefore, the other options—farm, town, and city—are not likely his best options as they are likely either expensive overnight fees or don't offer discounts or weekly rates.<n><n>Hotels are typically more expensive than motels, with a higher rate per night. Motels are slightly more likely to be found in a town or city, while hotels can be found in big cities and towns.<n>

Choices:  A: make noise B: band C: museum D: concert hall E: rubber band<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A) <n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Your task is to write a function named sumPrimes2 that takes an any positive number (int) and returns that number. The function should check whether that number is prime or not and if it is true that the number is prime, it will return 1. The else will return 0. For example, given 19 as inputs, the function would return 1, not 0.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>```java<n><n>public class Num {<n>    public static int sumPrimes2(final int n) {<n>        int r=0;<n>        boolean isPrime=true;<n>        for(int i=2;i<n;i++){<n>            if((n%i) == 0){<n>                System.out.println("Number is not a prime");<n>                isPrime=false;<n>            }<n>        }<n>        if(isPrime){<n>            System.out.println(sumPrimes2(n/2));<n>            return 1;<n>        }else{<n>            return 0;<n>        }<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Instraction:<n><n>There has been no rain (00) days for weeks in a row and people in the small town of Hug are desperate for rain. They have set up a special event where a group of four people (01, 02, 03) will make an estimate for the number of days until rain will finally start to fall. If the estimate is too low, the 01 person will lose and must pay one dollar for each day past their estimate. The same thing happens to 02 and 03. The one estimate that is closest to the end of not having rain will not pay anything, the prize is a pony named Twister!<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>```java<n>public class Num { <n><n>    public static void main(String[] args) {<n>        Summarize03 sum03 = new Summarize03();<n>        int input = 0;<n>        System.out.println();<n>        sum03.run(input);<n>    }<n>} <n><n>class Summarize03 {<n>    int n, sum;<n>    public void run(int i) {<n>       <n>        int numT

Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. Choices:  A: northern B: nome C: tromsø D: finnmark E: vadsø<n><n>### Response:		D (Finmark)<n>>Dear ______________,<n><n> >Polar nights half marathon is a run organized by a non-governmental organization. In this run there is something special for the competitors and the one who finishes it.<n><n> >Finmark(sometimes called Finnmarken) is the northernmost county of Norway. The population was 94,308 in 2019. It is the largest county of Norway<n><n> >The municipality is located in Troms og Finnmark county, which is Norway's northernmost county. It is bordered to the north by Russia. It borders the Nordkapp Municipality and the Varanger Municipality in the south, Vadsø Municipality in the northeast, and Sør-Varanger Municipality in the southeast.<n><n> >Finning in Finnmarken is very good, since the coast has shallow beaches. There are also a lot of streams and fjords of good fishing. <n><n><n>You can find your best location in: https://www.touropia.com/things-to-do-norwegian-border-village-north-norway/<n>

You may not be wearing your seatbelt to the store.<n><n>### Input(1): How can we get to the restaurant?<n><n>### Response(1): You can drive there.<n><n>### I/Me<n><n>### Demand: In English grammar, the difference between formal and less formal language is called _____.<n><n>### Solution(Demand): Register<n><n>### Demostration of use(Demanding):<n><n>I ate some pizza. It was delicious.<n><n>Driving is hard. It takes a lot of energy and coordination to do well.<n><n>She did really well at the test. You should feel very proud.<n><n>You should do your reading assignment. It will help you do well on the test.<n><n>### Writing:<n><n>I need help with my reading assignment. I know it will help me do well on the test, but I need your help and I can not do it alone.<n><n>### A word that needs to be capitalized<n><n>### Demistake:<n><n>### Demetail:<n><n>### Definition:<n><n>### Detail:<n><n>## Pronunciation:<n><n>## Preparation<n><n>## Proof reading:<n><n>## Reading:<n><n>## Grammar<n><n>## Writing:<n>	`<n>

Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What is an way for people to meet with each other? Choices:  A: believe in god B: pay bills C: group together D: enjoy themselves E: face each other<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Context:<n>* Believe in god: God is the only one way of people meet with each other.<n>* Pay bills: People meet with each other while paying bills.<n>* Group together: Group together is the only way of people meet with<n>* Enjoy themselves: Enjoy themselves is impossible way to meet with each other. The group cannot share the fun.<n>* Face each other:  Face each other is the important way to meet with each people.<n><n>### Input :Choices:  A: more  expensive  B: more  luxurious  C: more  convenient  D: more  spacious  E: more  high tech  F: same  price  G: same  style  H: same  color  I: same  size<n><n>### Response :A<n><n>### Context :<n>* more expensive: Expensive is the common way to get people meet with each other, because rich people must pay expensive to keep their wealth.<n>* more luxurious: People like luxurious, they must pay expensive to get luxurious.<n>* more convenient: Convenient is impossible way to get people meet.<n>* more spacious: Spacious is the common feature to meet with each other but we need expensive to get.<n>* more high tech: High Tech is the feature to meet with each people, we should pay more expense to get this.<n>* same price: Same price is the same feature of all cars. Car with higher quality will be same expensive to use.<n>* same style: Style is the feature to meet people with each other.<n><n><n>

How many muffins did Sam and Toby eat together?<n>How much food does a family with 3 people need to last 3 days?<n><n>## Input :<n>Sam: 4/10 of a cup I eat.   Toby: 3/10 of a muffin  I eat.   <n><n>## Response : <n>Sam: 21/10 of a cups of food Toby : 2/10 of a  muffin food.   <n><n># <n># 3. What is the volume of the box with square base?<n>How long is box?<n>How much is the height of box?<n>What was the volume?<n><n>## Input:<n>1. The base has a length of 25 cm., a width of 45 cm., and a height of 28 cm. (3)<n>2. The density is 7 pounds per cubic foot ((76.205 lb/ft³).   <n><n>## 1.Response:<n>1. It should be 1,538 cubic inches<n>(<n>28,814<n><n>cm<n> )<n>                <n>        (25)(45)<n><n>2. It should be 78 pounds per cubic feet<n>(21.235<n><n>lb/ft³<n> )<n>                <n><n># 4. A bicyclist has a speed of 7 km/hr (1,448 meters/hr). Each should be a single answer; it shouldn't jump like you want to jump with a question and answer separated into different sections.<n><n>You should also include a [mre].

Choices:  A. 3<n>B. 12<n>C. 15<n>D. 18<n><n>### Instructor:Your first assignment is to write a loop that prints a number pattern in increments of 4.<n><n>### Requirements: The function should return the loop index.<n><n>### Response<n><n>{% highlight javascript linenos=table %}<n>function evenOddSequence(num=4){<n>  if(num>0){<n>    if(num%2==0){<n>      console.log(num);<n>    }<n>    num--;<n>    console.log(num+" ");<n>    if (num==-1){<n>      console.info(num+"; finished sequence");<n>      return num;<n>    }<n>    evenOddSequence(4);<n>  }<n>}<n>{% endhighlight %}<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>* To make the loops, copy and paste the code sample above<n>* To test the loop, paste this number in the text box above and press play<n><n>* To change the number of the sequence,  change 4 to a higher number<n>   * Note: 4 is the minimum number you can use for the loop in this lesson<n><n><n>### Output<n><n>* Output will be a number sequence like 4,8,12,16,...<n><n># JavaScript functions<n><n>### Instuction:<n><n>Teacher: Can you use these JavaScript functions?<n><n>Student: Yes<n><n>### Instracction:<n>Copy these 3 code snippets:<n>```javascript<n>function test(){<n>    return "this is a test";<n>}<n><n>function printEvenOddSequence(num){<n>    console.log("the loop number is "+num)<n>    if(num>0 ){<n>        if(num%2 == 0){<n>            console.log(num)<n>        }else{<n>            num--;<n>            printOddSequence(num);<n>        }<n>    }<n>    if(num ==0){<n>        console.log("the sequence does not have

The victim’s family takes revenge by suing Joe for millions of dollars.<n><n>### Input (2): The people who ate the most peanuts were Tom, John and Frank. Tom finished with 14 peanuts left. John finished with 6 peanuts. Frank finished with 3 peanuts. John's number was 5 less than 1/3 of Tom’s number. How many peanuts did they all eat altogether?<n><n>### Response (2):<n>B.<n><n>Tom finished with 16.5 peanuts left<n>John finished with 6 peonuts left<n>Frank finished with 3 peonuts left<n>Tom's number was 26.5 1/3<n>1/3 of 26.5=8 4/5<n>8 4/5 - 6=2<n><n>### Input:(3): Janet has 9  pieces  of  clothing  less  than  Peter . Choices:  A,  B(4),  C(9),  D(19),  E(29)<n><n>### Response:(3):<n>D.<n><n>Janet has 9  piecrs of  clothing less than Peter.<n>If she has 7 pieces of clothing, we could say that she has 2 pieces more than Peter.<n>(9–7)+1=2<n><n>## 40<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Choose the answer to the question(s) that completes the request. How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The man went to clown college, he had always want to run away with the what? Choices:  A: circus B: carnival C: surprise D: spoons E: party<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input<n>You've probably played with the spinoff of the card game solitaire called computer solitaire. In computer solitaire, an "easy" computer plays against you.<n>You're trying to arrange 36 cards which are numbered 1-36 on the left and 36 on the right, in an ordered fashion. The computer plays every card on the left. You don't get any points for cards on your side. However, if your side is orderly and the computer can't play any cards, then the computer moves on to your pile. If all cards on the right are gone before the computer moves to the pile, you have won the game!<n>The computer begins by moving the #1 card on the right to an unoccupied hole on the left side in an unordered fashion. This will always result in you receiving fewer points than if the card had been played correctly. Each time the computer has a choice of two options, it will choose the action which is more likely to lead to a "WIN NEXT MOVE", or WNM. How can you change the algorithm to make the computer play the optimal strategy, with WNM playing until it runs out of cards, then taking the winner?<n>Your algorithm must always play WNM until you are able to declare a winner. If the game cannot be won, your algorithm needs to play the game again until the computer wins.<n>Note: There are multiple cards (not yet played) that can yield a perfect solution; your algorithm needs to choose the card which will be the one played next.<n>### Response: the algorithm to make the  computer play the optimal strategy to choose<n><n>### Input :<n>The man wants to pick up a pumpkin from the pumpkin patch on the way to visit his grandparents at the nursing home.  The pumpkin patch is two blocks from his house, four blocks from the nursing home, and six blocks from the car dealership. <n>He must first walk the four blocks from the house to the nursing home in order to pick up his children. After dropping off his children, he must walk three blocks through the neighborhood to the pumpkin patch, but will have to walk just one more block back to the car dealership to get his pumpkin - so he'll go there last.<n>If he starts from his

Choices:  A: factory B: construction site C: engine D: insides of skyscraper's walls E: shops<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input : The population of New York City increased by 100,000 people in 1980. At the rate it was increasing 10 years before, how many more people did the city have in 1990?<n>A) 400,00 B) 425,000 C) 300,00 D) 200,00<n>### Demonstartion:<n>New York 1980 <n>```<n>100,04,00 	-------> x 1.8x<n>999900 ------> x 1.9x<n>99956,43 x1.9x ---<------<n>8076 x 1.9 = 15,75,600<n>```<n>```<n>10100400 x 1.8<n>```<n>``` -------><n>1.128 x 1.8	 <n>= 1.7 million<n><n>New York 1080 <n>``` -------> 1.7<n>1<n>500000 --> 95<n>```<n>```------> 1.9672x<n> 108/1.967x ---><n>= 5.487x =<n>5 lakhs =<n>50<n>```<n>### Instruction : Answer the following multiple choice question<n>### Demonstariation:<n>``` -----><n>1.8x <1.9 <n>1.7 <1.967<n>```<n><n>### Input<n>In 1992, the population of the capital of California was 1,475,700. In 2008, the population of the city increased by 167,240 people. <n>If the rate of increase in population is 2.5% per year, how many people live in the city now?<n>```<n>1475700x<n>--------------> <n>0.025x<n>------- --> 1.128x<n>x7 --><n>167240  -->  <n>---------------> 1775584<n><n>----------------------><n>1992

Choices:  A: store B: classroom C: backpack D: cabinet E: teacher<n><n>### Response:		He went to a store<n>### Instruction;Write the question (answering question)<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Question:What did he buy?<n>Answer: He needed to buy pencils.<n><n>### Input;The student has A: 7 white pencils and B: 5 color pencils.<n>### Response: He did not have any pencil.<n>### Instruction:(answering a question)<n><n>1.There were more color pencils<n>2.The student did not have a color pencils<n>3.He only had some white pencils he bought<n>4.The student only had 8 pencils (white pencils)<n><n>Question:How many pencils did he have when he left the store?<n>Answer: He had 8 pencil<n><n>Question:He needed to buy pencil. Did he buy pencil?<n>Answer: Yes, he bought pencil.<n><n>Question:Where did he go after that?<n>Answer:He walked back home but stopped at a park and had lunch.<n><n>Question;Where did he eat lunch?<n>### Response:<n>His lunchbox, his favorite sandwich, and he had an apple.<n><n>### Question;Did the student go to the store after that?<n><n>### Response;The student went to back to the store.<n><n>### When a student needs pencils, he may not have the color pencils at home, so he needs to buy more pencils. He bought 5 of one kind of pencil and 7 of a different kind. His total number of pencils was 7 plus 5, which is 12. How did his total number of pencil change after he bought other pencils?<n>### Response;<n>The student's total number of pencills changed to 7 plus 12

Choices:  A: active B: hunger C: in motion D: wakefulness E: lay down<n><n>### Response:		I was not hungry this morning<n>### Input:Tessie is on the 3rd floor of their high school. From her room window, she can see the parking lot below. She looks out the window and sees an unknown car parked one space from the front door. The person drives out and parks by the dumpster located behind the school. By following the same route, how many spaces is Tessie from her room window?<n><n>#### Answer: -6<n>#### Explanation:1st space from the front door => parking is 7 spaces away. From front door to bottom of stairs => 7 steps. From bottom of stairs to dumpster to the back => 7 steps again. Since the steps are 7 long every time, after following the same route 6 times, you will end up at the dumpster.<n>

How many two digit numbers are possible?<n><n>## Answer:<n><n>### Input:\> What is the third digit of 566?<n><n>### Instruct:<n>Answer using number (not numbered list): What is the third digit that is 6?<n><n>## Instructions:Input:What is the third digit that belongs to 566?What is the third digit of the number 566?The first digit of 563 is 5 and the second digit is 6.The eighth digit is 7.The tenth digit is 5.The second digit is 5.\> What is the third number?The fifth digit of 456 is 9.The sum of the last four digits is 10.The second digit is the eighth digit.The fourth digit is 4.How many digits are in 4000001?<n><n>## Output:<n>1)566<n><n>**Input**: The first digit of 407 is 4 and the second digit is0. The second digit is 6, the sum is 12. The last digit is 4 and the last digit is 4. The second digits exceed 12. The first two digits is 2. <n>**Output**: 4<n><n>### Instrument:<n>### Instruction:(Reasoning required)<n>### Input:<n>### Instrument (Reasoning / Strategy required): <n>### Output:<n>### Solution:<n>### Instructs:<n>### Input: Input: How many 7/8’s can be made with 34 coins? Choices:  A: mail box B: suitcase C: front door D: bowl E: post office<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>###### Answer<n><n>###### Input<n>Letters are sometimes delivered through...<n><n>-A: the Post office<n>-B: front door<n>-C: bowl<n>-D: mail box<n>-E: suitcase<n><n>### Answer:<n>I chose option...<n><n><n><details><n><summary><strong>Explanation</strong></summary><n><n>[View Answer](explanation\answer.md)<n></details><n><n>**Answer:**...because<n><n><details> <n><summary><strong><i>Explain your answer</i></strong></summary><n><p><n><details><n><n># A<n>[Learn More: Explore the Code](coding-language\answer.md) <n>[Learn and Review: Glossary](glossary-word) <n>Lesson: [Answering Multiple Choice, Short Response, and Identification Questions in Math Games and Books](link-to-lesson) <n>Quizzies: [Answering Multiple-Choice and Short-Response Questions in Math Games](link-to-review)<n><n></div><n><details>  </details><n><details> </details></p><n></details><n></details>

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The president had to make a decision regarding the hate attack on his country, what did he do? Choices:  A: wage war B: fight enemy C: kill D: destroy enemy E: attacked his country<n><n>### Response:		President Trump will wage war to show his strength and unity of his citizens.<n><n>### Input (part 2):What did the president do after winning his war? Choices: 1)B: fought enemy 2)C: attacked his country 3)D: fought enemy 4)A: waged war 5)killed himself<n><n>### Response(part 2) the president will show his citizens that they have the power of unity by waging war.

Choices:  A: school B: home office C: people store D: print shop E: newspaper office<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Explanation:This question can be answered by using division.<n>First, you would have to find out how many gallons are in a hundred gallons. There are 128 gallons in a hundred gallons so the answer would be 512 gallons. You would then have to subtract both amounts which would give you 212 gallons. This is basically the same as a simple subtraction problem so the answer is 212 gallon.<n><n>### Input/Output:<n><n>### Input :If a 5 gallon container can hold 7 liters, what volume can a 25 gallon container hold?<n><n>### Response :A 25 gallon will hold 797.728 gallons.<n><n>### Exploration/Explanation :As you see, this question is just a simple proportion problem in which you divide liters in a 5 gallon by liters in the 25 gallon. Multiply the proportion and you get the expected answer.<n><n>### Task:<n><n>### Instructions:Analyze the text below, then type your response.<n><n>### The New York Times<n><n>If you have an idea you want to share with The Times, email:<n>[theanswer@nytimes.com](theanswer@nytimes).<n><n>The Answer, the Times' reader-focused response column, features reader-submitted responses to select questions.<n><n>If you have a question you want the Times to consider, email: <n>[TheAnswer@nytimes.com.](TheAnswer@nytimes).<n>### Demonstation:<n><n>### We get into many arguments regarding homework and chores with our own kids, so we thought we'd hear from a few parents about their methods and how they balance their responsibilities as parents with their responsibilities as professionals.<n>### The best way is to have a meeting at the beginning of the week to discuss the kids' chores and help them plan their homework with you. This could be done over breakfast or while the kids have a snack before school. In my experience, most parents wait for some sort of drama to happen, and as a result they end up either being rushed into a decision or ending up overwhelmed. That's why it

Choices:  A: bus stop B: graph C: post office D: grass E: play<n><n>### Response:		<n>I could add the line graph or the playground<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>> A: I stopped by the bus stop in order to get to my job.<n>> B: There are a lot of bus stops near the post office.<n>> C: He took a bus to work.<n>> D: I took a walk on my break.<n>> E: I played outside until the sun went down.<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Add the information for each choice. Remember to do it as you go.<n><n>If you are stuck, scroll up to the example instructions to help you.<n><n>## Input:<n><n>I stopped by the bus stop at the end of my street.<n>There is a big bus stop near my house.<n>How many bus stops are near the post office? I think I counted 10 when I took a walk.<n>There is a bus stop on every corner in my town.<n>There are two bus routes near my house.<n><n>## Response:<n>I stopped by the playground at the end of my block for a quick break.<n>There is a ballpark a block away.<n>There are a lot playgrounds where I like to play.<n>Are there other places you like to walk on your break?<n>I think it is good to walk during breaks while working.<n><n>## Instruction:<n><n>Write a response that describes the following task.<n><n>Input:<n><n>I stopped at the 5/10 store on my way home to get a bag of chips.  I bought a large bottle of coke for $4.00.  How much change did I get back?  I gave the cashier a twenty and got back five singles, a three, and a one.  What is the total amount that I saved in change (the amount of the bill minus the amount saved)?<n><n>Output:<n><n>Since I spent nineteen dollars and I gave the casher a twenty, I can expect to get $1 back in change from that purchase.<n><n>When I walked out of the store with my bag of chips and 2 liter of Coca Cola I had a total of $5.80 of change in my hand.<n><n>

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:How can one's views change after learning about science? How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:In the middle of the day what will someone do because of being hungry? Choices:  A: cook dinner B: make bread C: eat in restaurant D: have lunch E: make bread<n><n>### Response:		In the middle of day what will someone do? B: Bread<n><n>### Instructions: Choose the correct letter.<n><n>A. ______  Choice: E  B. ______  Bread C. ______  restaurant D. ______  Lunch E. ______  cook dinner<n><n>### Instructin:Answer the following single choice question: Choose the best answer for the following question.<n><n>A. Which type of food has meat the most?<n><n>A. ____ A. Meat B. Pizza C. Sandwiche D. Cheesecake E. Pepe<n><n>B. Which is the best type of drink in the country: tea or coffee?<n><n>B. ____ A. Coffee B. Tea<n><n>C. Which type of fruit is the best: apple or mango?<n><n>C. ____ A. Apple B. Mango<n><n>D. Which is the best of the following: chocolate, cheese, cheesecake or cake?<n><n>D. ____ A. Cheesecake B. Cake<n><n>E. Which should we eat every day: meat, fish or pasta?<n><n>E. ____ A. Fish B. Pasta C. Meat<n><n>### Instracions:Answer the following multiple option question.<n><n>## Answer<n><n><n><n><n><n>## References

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. The population of a town is increasing by 6% each year, but this year population increased by -50%. What was this year's population?<n><n>### Output:-695<n><n>### Reason:<n><n>##### A:Increase by 6% of this years:6% x 695=-36.45+6% x (-50)=-695<n><n>Or<n><n>##### B: Increase by 55% of this years: 55%x695=-598.75-41.7% x (-50)<n>##Bonus Instructions: If you want a grade higher than D, your report must contain 40+ words and be organized appropriately. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Eating breakfast in bed can make you feel what, assuming that you don't spill anything? Choices:  A: vomiting B: pleasure C: happiness D: contentment E: mess<n><n>### Response:		E - "vomiting"

On Tuesday 3 gallons of water were purchased. Each day there were three more gallons left in the container than there were on the day before. There were 14 gallons left in the bucket on Thursday. How many gallons of water were there at the start?<n><n>### Demstration:<n>Ans. (10+3)(3+1) = 5+3(1+1)= 17 gallons <n>### Instruction<n>Demonstrate how you would solve the problem.<n><n>### Response<n>Ans. 10+3=13 3(1+1) =4<n>

What is the probability that the worker leaving the building goes to the same door as the door that the worker returning enters?" Add 5 to n. n is now 5. 2. n is 1 fewer than p. p is now 3. 3. Twice n is 10. n is now 154. 4. The product of 2x-4 and -x is -8. What is the value of x?<n><n>### Your response<n><n>1. 5+n=10<n><n>2. n-1=2<n><n>3. nx=10<n><n>4. -3x=-8<n><n>### Input   :How many ways can you write the following number 2,975?<n><n>### How many ways are there to write 2975?<n>Answer: 85<n><n>### Input    :Dominic earned 15, 20, 32,and 31 dollars for each of the four days. The teacher must be around at all times.<n><n>### Which of these things should not be allowed in class?<n>A. Food<n>B. Notebooks<n>C. Pencil cases<n>D. Pens<n><n>### If multiple choice is the only option on an assignment, an incorrect answer choice is A. All incorrect answers are written in A.<n>A. Every answer is either false or is false in some cases<n><n>### The best strategy to respond to a multiple choice question is to randomly guess.<n>A. Every incorrect answer choice has a chance to be incorrect.<n>B. You can eliminate the wrong answer choices.<n>C. You can eliminate all incorrect answer choices.<n>D. There is no right answer<n><n>### What does a multiple choice response mean?<n>An option is true or false.<n><n>### How does the strategy of elinimination affect the student's response?<n>A. It allows your students to choose the correct answer.<n>B. It enables your students to choose all the correct answers.<n>C. There is no correct answer.<n>D. Using it helps me to make better decisions<n><n>### What is the strategy of elimination?<n>It is used to identify the false statements of an essay.<n><n>### If a response is not on the assignment, students cannot be penalized if they choose it.<n>A. Students can use another response<n>B. Students cannot use another answer if it does not belong to the assignment<n>C. All answer choices on the assignment are correct<n>D. There is a chance that students will make a valid response on other answers<n><n>### Is rephrasing a good way to respond incorrectly to a multiple choice question that is more complex than it is difficult to do?<n>A. By replying, the teacher gives her students a better opportunity to answer, without giving any credit at all for doing so.<n>B. It allows the teacher to answer the questions of the students without giving them the correct

Choices:  A: netherlands B: utrecht C: brussels D: belgium E: denmark<n><n>### Response:		The country that has Fortis bank as their bank is The Netherlands. If Amsterdam is the capital then it is the Netherlands. I can confirm this by looking at my bank account, I recently got a Fortis Visa credit card and an Fortis Mastercard, therefore I can be sure to conclude that The Netherlands is my bank.<n><n>### Input - How much can Joe and Janie save if they were able to cut their water usage by half? If Joe uses 20% less water, he saves 0.5 gallons each day. If Janie uses 100% less water, she saves 5 gallons each day, but she also uses 50% less water each day. (A) Joe's savings are greater than Janie's by how much each day? (B) Joe's savi<n><n>### Response - If you have the two equations for Janie and Joe then you can solve those and come up with the answer;<n><n>Savings = 100% + 25%<n>To solve for Joe<n>Savings = (1/2) + (1/2)  = 3/4<n>To solve for Janie<n>Savings = ((1/2) + 5/2) +  (0.5 +0.5)<n><n>### Input  - On the way home from school, Maria takes the bus to the park. On Sunday, her mom gives her $7 to buy a bike. She buys a bike that costs $20 more than half her $7 budget plus $7. How much will Maria's mom pay the seller?<n><n>### Response  - $17; $14.30, $5.70<n><n>### Instructions  - On his way home from school, Marcus has a total of $80: 2 red bikes, 2 blue bikes, and a tan bike.  <n><n>### Demotion:<n>- They add humor or entertainment as they present.<n><n>- They take chances and try something new when speaking.<n><n>- They use a “talking stick” or other objects to encourage audience participation.<n><n>- They read from a script that they have written or prepared.<n><n>- They offer the audience some things to take away, if applicable, to promote future discussions.<n><n>- They provide additional ways for people who cannot attend the event (i.e. online access) to learn about their topic.<n><n>- They encourage others to present ideas.<n><n>- They find other ways to interact with the audience beyond the meeting itself.<n><n>### Respond:<n>A lot!<n><n>### Instuct:<n>What do you try to include to be more engaging?<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>Describe a time you had to change directions or approach.<n><n>### Demo:<n>- I had an employee who used a certain formula when she was putting a sales order together to account for the materials on hold. So, she could change the number of parts if she had the wrong number held or wanted to do a special promotion.<n><n>- I didn’t get along with that employee and had to

He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What are students trying to do? Choices:  A: study philosophy B: become adult C: ask questions D: further education E: study together<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following question in 50-100 words.<n>- A: Study philosophy<n> - What is philosophy?<n>   - Philosophy is an area of study that aims to answer the most important questions about the world in general and humanity's place in it.<n> - What is the most important question in philosophy? <n>   - The most important question in philosophy is about the nature of reality.<n>- B: Become an adult<n> - How do you become an adult?<n>   - Adulthood refers to a period of life when individuals are physically mature, responsibly care for other human beings, and are capable of making responsible decisions that meet the needs of others, not just their own.<n>- C: Ask questions<n> - What kind of questions do people ask you when they are learning?<n>   - Some common questions that students may ask are: “What is the correct way to do this?” “How can I solve this problem?””Why do I need to know this?”<n> - What kind of things do you need to know to answer these questions?<n>   - Students need to know the materials in the curriculum and also they need to know the skills required to solve the problems that they are facing.<n>   - Students can use all their senses to understand what is being asked. For example, they can refer to a diagram or model and then listen to a lecture to understand what exactly it is asking them to do.<n> - What do you need to do when you need to ask someone else a question?<n>   - Try to describe the situation clearly and explain what you already know and what type of information or help you are seeking.<n> - Do you understand the different way questions are asked?<n>   - Yes, different ways of asking different types of questions, including: informal questions where there is no concern about whether something is correct or incorrect; open-ended questions where the speaker waits for input from others before answering or explaining; closed-ended questions where answers are expected, but not required; conditional questions, which depend on prior information; embedded questions, where one person asks another for information within a single sentence.<n>- D: Have further education<n> - What are the differences between higher education and further education?<n>   - Both higher education and further education involve teaching or training within a formal setting (e.g., school).  However, they differ in that higher education is often associated with four-year

Choices:  A: small B: underground C: high D: huge E: tall<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**A(Underground building)**<br><n>Underground is an adjective that refers to being below the surface. Underground tunnels, metro stations, water pipes, and sewage piping are the examples of the adjective “Underground” that is used to describe the below surface.<br><br><n>The Empire State building is an example of a building that is well-known for its height. It is located in New York City. The Empire State Building is 443.2 meters (1,454 feet) tall.<n><br><br><n>**E( tall building)**<br><br>Tall is an adjective. <br>Tall refers to height or size. It may also refer to an outlook or view. <br><br><n>There are various tall buildings located all over the world. These buildings have various uses. <br><n>Some tall buildings are used as hotels, offices, shopping complexes, restaurants and entertainment centers etc.<br><br>Some tall buildings are used for residential purposes such as house, flats, and apartments, etc.<br><br><br>Empire State building is also a tall building. It is well known for its height. It stands at 443.4 meters of height (1,458 feet). It is one of the tallest buildings in the New York City area, one of the tallest ones in the world, and the fifth-tallest structure in the Northern Hemisphere. Empire State building is 36 meters taller than the other two tallest skyscrapers of New York City area. <br><br><br><br>(Tall is an adjectives that refers to the height)<n><br>### Write the answer for every input or else 0<n>

How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The lady was getting worked up about the article explaining the uptick in accidents in their area, but her husband was dismissive of it stating that accidents what? Choices:  A: happen to people B: hurt people C: happen anytime D: happen often E: happen anywhere<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input<n>The lady was getting worked about the article in the newpaper explaining the uptick of accidents incoulding her neighborhood, but her husband wasdismissive saying that accidents  ____.<n><n>### Response<n>A.Happen to people<n><n>### Choice:<n><n>A.Happen anywhere<n><n>### A.Happen everywhere<n>![ExamFLE](./images/Exam FLE 120.jpg)<n><n># Reference<n>https://github.com/nicholasmarchant/AlgorithmDesign/tree/master/Exercises/Exam%20FLE%20Questions/1%20-%20Mid-Term%20Questions<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where are you likely to find a professional prostitute? Choices:  A: new york B: whorehouse C: street corner D: corner of two streets E: brother<n><n>### Response:		The answer is on the street corner, 16.<n><n>### Input<n><n>On the road to the school, Mariah has 3 times as many chairs as Sharon. At the same time on a street in Houston, 6.6 fewer chairs than there are skyscrapers.<n><n>In a school, there are 3 times more green chairs than red chairs. 3 more students in another school choose red over green for their chairs. In another school, there are twice as many black and white chairs as red and green chairs combined.<n><n>How many chairs are there across the three schools?<n><n>### Response<n><n>There are 200 chairs across the three schools since 2 times 2 times 2 equals 200.<n><n>### Recommendation:<n><n>The recommendation is to use the "if" conditional when programming, which may help with this task.<n><n>### Assigned Task:Roll dice to find a solution. Do not solve algebraically as you did with Task 2 and Task 3.<n><n>### Roll 1:If you roll a one on a die and it is the only roll you get for the question you are missing zero out of 12, so you get a mark of 1.<n><n>### Response:"The mark is 10 out of 12"<n><n>### Roll:If it's not your first time, you can use a computer program.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Why would you not want to be working with wood? Choices:  A: blisters B: frustration C: being paid D: make money E: money<n><n>### Response:		If you are not paid to work, then there is no benefit.<n><n>### Input. Answer the question True or False.<n><n>### True or False: I made the right choice in this?<n><n>### Correct Answer: True<n><n>---<n>######  A: If you were paying people to help then you would not be working with wood.<n>I: I made the wrong choice then.<n><n>---<n>#### **What if...**<n>Suppose you work by yourself and someone gets harmed, I assume you would think it was not worth it.<n><n>----<n>

How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:John had a lot of respect for Jill, but not many other people did.  She faced a lot of what? Choices:  A: ignoring B: being rude C: disparagement D: contumely E: uncertainty<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Output:The amount of damage caused by the explosion was almost equal to the amount of damage caused by fire.<n><n>### Explanation:Equality sign indicates equality, so “A lot of damage caused by the fire” can be written as “A lot of damage Caused by fire.”, and “almost equal to” can be written as A large amount of, then the final expression can be written as:<n><n>Lot of damage = $A lot of damage caused = $Caused by fire ≥ $The amount of damage caused = $caused by fire <n><n>Similarly, “The amount of damage caused” can be written as "The amount of damage”.<n>

He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What are you hoping to do when listening to an expert speak? Choices:  A: learning B: fatigue C: mercy D: empathy E: anxiety<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions :<n>Use the same format to make a response to the following questions<n><n>### Instruct:  Choose the letter corresponding to the choices.<n><n>### Answer: A<n><n>## Question 2<n>In the question that follows, complete the statement, using the correct mathematical symbols and/or the correct format (exponential, fraction, decimal point, etc.).<n><n>Write a word that the answer will be a multiple of.<n><n>In these examples, _the answer is a multiple of 7_.<n><n>|Answer|What is the number that will make the answer a multiple of 7?|<n><n><n>```javascript<n>   12<n>   17<n>   15<n>   64<n>   14<n>```<n>## Question 3<n><n>This question contains two statements, each with four blanks. Choose the best set of numbers for the blanks that makes grammatically correct statements and complete the question. Choices are given in multiple choices.<n><n>A man is five times as old as his son. Ten years from now he will be nine times as old as his grandson. How old is the grandson?<n><n>What is the answer?<n><n>|Answer|Set of numbers in statement A with blanks|Set of numbers in B with blanks|<n><n>Answer|C-D|<n><n><n><n>```javascript <n><n>   5  <n>     B 12<n>     G 54<n>     F 54<n>     A G 72<n><n><n>```<n><n>### Difficulty:What is the answer? What is the average of the first three answers?<n><n>### Answer  for Difficulty:If A is the average of B and C, what is the average of A and D?<n><n>Answer|B|<n><n><n><n><n><n>```<n>1 0 1 0 3 0<n>-2 0 2 0 5 2<n>B= -2<n>C = 2<n><n><n>```

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:A person takes a seat to watch a movie, where is he? Choices:  A: in cinema B: at the park C: martorell D: jeep E: airplane<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: in cinema<n><n>### Input:#. The store owner bought $49.25 worth of toilet paper. When he bought a new box of toilet paper, he paid $5.48 for each new box. The price of the previous box of toilet tissue was $6.89 per box. How many boxes did he buy?<n><n>### # Demonstration<n><n>Inputs:$49.25<n><n>The store owner bought the first box, which was the last box, since we know he must have bought at least two boxes, and therefore the price was not divisible by 4.925, so the new price must be divisible by 4 and a half, meaning that 5 must be the new box price. Since the store owner bought a new box, this means that the price of toilet paper increased, which means that when the owner bought the first box it cost less, so a previous box must have given him $49.27.<n><n>Input:$49.27<n><n>#### Explanation:<n>The store owner bought ten boxes initially because 49.27/6.89 = 7.24, which is not a whole number, so that means he must have bought a partial box, the price he paid for the partial box would be 49.20, which means he paid 49.25 minus 0.05 and if we continue this trend, the owner, on his second to last box, paid 54.80, which means the previous box cost 49.23, and this would go on for seven boxes until the owner bought the final box for 68.90.

How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:A musician is most likely to perform a concerto for clarinet with what type of group? Choices:  A: believe in god B: sun themselves C: eat hamburgers D: gain wealth E: eat plants<n><n>### Response:		Vegetarians eat more vegetables and fruits since they believe that these are all they need to live a healthy life. They are against eating burgers and meat and meat dishes, and they do not believe that God made plants for us humans for us to eat.<n><n>#### Question: In which state does George live? Choices: Washington A: Virginia  B: California  C: New Mexico  D: Texas<n><n>#### Response: George lives in Virginia.<n><n>#### Questions: How many hours does Gwen spend reading? Choices: 1: 100 hours 2: 200 hours 3: 300 hours 4: 400 hours<n><n>#### Response: Gwen spends 400 hours reading because it takes her 2 hours to finish every book she reads at 20 pages/hour.<n><n>#### Question (hard): Jill lives 1 block away from her friend, Diana. Diana lived by the school. Jill takes 2 blocks to get to the school and 2 more blocks to go to the shopping center. If Jill arrives at the shopping center, what can her friend have done during that time?<n><n>#### Response: Diana arrived at the school while Jill is still there.<n><n>#### Question(hard): If a bicycle and a car each travel 5 blocks in the same direction and both are moving at 5 units/min, which of the two will arrive first to its destination?<n><n>#### Response(hard): Bicycle.<n><n>#### Question:(medium): When the train arrives at the station, how long does it take? <n><n>#### Response:(medium): It takes half an hour because each train station is separated by 50km and the train goes 50 km/hour.

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:What do humans do when they want to reproduce? Choices:  A: eat ice cream B: have sex C: sit down D: make mistakes E: hear sounds<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Demo:<n>Input: What do humans do when they wish to have children? How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon. How do you find the area of a shaded region when the area is given in terms of the dimensions of the square? <n><n>### A. How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:The animals weren't good at swimming, so it was hard for them to do what? Choices:  A: pass water B: bathe C: listen to each other D: feel pleasure E: reproduce asexually<n><n>### Response:		The animals weren't able to reproduce asexually, thus, they had to bath in the water.<n>### Instruction The animals weren' t good at swimming, how did they listen to each other?<n>### Demonostration:<n>The animals were not able to reproduce asexuall y. As such, they had to take baths in the water. They were therefore able to talk with each other.<n><n><n>### Input One snake and two frogs started to walk from London to the North pole. In the evening, the frogs were halfway to the North pole, the snakes were two thirds of the way. How far had the snakes and the frogs walked altogether?<n><n>### Input When they arrive in London, two snakes and a frog decide to return home and walk from the North pole to London. Two thirds of the way home, they are twice as far from London as they were when they started their trip. How far had the animals walked at the start of the journey?<n><n>### Response 1 The animals were all three times away from the North pole.<n>### Response 2 When the snake and the frog reached London, they were all 5 times more away from the North pole than when they started the journey.<n><n>### Solution<n>### Instruction 1 (Snakes and frogs):<n><n>In order to reach London, the number of snake that have to be moved is equal to that of frogs. In this regard, they are moving with the same distance whereby, to meet London, the snakes have to travel 5 times the same distance as compared to frogs, 2/3rds of the total distance. In view of that, the number of snakes that travel to meet their destination is 5x/2.<n><n><n>## Solution 2 (Snakes, frogs and snake):<n><n>The animals had to travel in order to be away from the north pole. Their journey was therefore to meet the north pole. In their journey, they are able to meet London where. Upon their arrival, the snakes travelled to the north pole. As they arrived in London, the animals were able to meet north pole, whereby, the snake were able to travel to the north pole, 2/3 rd of the total distance as compared to that of frogs

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:He needed to check an electrical connection in the house, where did he look? Choices:  A: telephone network B: freeway C: company D: wall E: airport<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**My response:** <n><n>**Option (A):** A<n><n>**Option(B):** A<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>Anna wrote a number to Kyle in a letter. When she reads the rest of the letter, she realizes she wrote down the number 2 digits out of place. If the number was 27683, what number did she originally write?<n><n>### My response<n><n>**Answer:**  <n><n>**A:** 86200<n>**B:** 84580<n>**C:** 92830<n><n>### My answers explained<n><n>**Option(A):**<n><n>The number Kyle reads is 60823 because 60 + 8 is 68. 2 + 4 is 6. The number Kyle will notice is 82863. 60828 - 863 = 5215. 5 + 2 + 1 + 5 = 13. The number Kyle needs to subtract is 13, which is 61663, so Kyle will notice his original number was 61668.<n><n>### Option(B):<n><n>The number Kile reads is 84583 becuase 60 + 3 = 63. 2 + 3 = 5. The number Kyle notices is 84597. 6097 - 97 = 510. 5 + 1 + 0 = 6. The number I need to subtract is 6, so the number is 84562, which will be the number she uses in her question.<n><n>## Instructions<n><n>```<n>The next few days I will be training. If there are 75 books and 105 toy animals, how many books are there?<n><n>### Response1:<n><n>3 times as many means 3 books for every 1 toy animal, or 3:1. Thus the number of books is (105/3)*3 books. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Parents often yell in times of chaos, what are they trying to do? Choices:  A: guide children B: understand children C: control children D: care for children E: vent anger<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input:(a)  You and three of your friends are going on a trip through the Rocky Mountains. Your car can only fit five people comfortably with some things. You can buy 3 cars in a bus. Each of your friends can fit in one of the six cars of the bus. How many vehicles can fit in all? A: 6 B: 9 C: 12 D: 7<n><n>### Response:(b)  You and three other friends are going on a road trip. Your car can only accommodate five people comfortably with a few things. The friends can fit up to 6 cars. How many cars will there be in all?<n><n>---<n>© 2020 Trilogy Education Services, a 2U, Inc. brand. All Rights Reserved.

Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Water is an important ingredient in what sugary beverage? Choices:  A: mountain dew B: glass C: soft drink D: whirlpool bath E: coffee cup<n><n>### Response:		A:  A soft drink<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>### Input 17.9%  20% 10 miles to 75%<n><n>### Instructions: Calculate the percentage the figure 21 is of the figure 75.<n><n>### Request: "Do the operations from the 1st line and the 2nd line at the bottom. Do not do anything to the 3rd or 4th lines. The answer will be in the 5th and 6th lines."<n><n>### Response 15.45%  79%  30 miles<n><n>### Experiment:<n><n>### Request 16%  62% "15% of 62 is how much?"<n><n>### Response "33.6 %"<n><n>
