Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Where might a human sit for extended periods over a bowl of water? Choices:  A: bathroom B: solar system C: coffee shop D: space shuttle E: airport<n><n>### Response:		 C.<n><n>### Input 2:How far are you from your house? Choices: A: same room  B: hallway  C: kitchen  D: bedroom  E: living room <n><n>### Response 2:B.<n><n><n>### Inputs Explanation:<n>- Janet has 9 more cards than Brenda, and Mara has twice as much as Janet. Therefore, Janet has 211 cards, Mara has 41, and Brenda has 133.<n>- Pete walked 50 blocks from his house to his bus stop, then rode the last 20 blocks to his destination.<n><n>- There are 2 blue chairs, 3 green chairs, and 3 white chairs. There is a total of 6 chairs in the room, which is what is meant by a classroom.<n>- It was given that 4.5 gallon of coffee were divided among the 3 thermoses. Genevive drank an entire thermos, so she must have drank 3 pints (1/2 gallons) of coffee, which was indeed 6 pints after she drank the whole last thermos<n>- Alannah has 10 more books than Beatix. Queen 5 books. Beatrix has a total of 110. Queen 160, Alannah 290, so together the three have 600 books.<n>- 4/7 means 4/7/4, which means he gets 4 (or 1/2) of something and 7 (or 3/5) of something else for every 4 he gives away.<n>- Since Voltaire gets 20 viewers per day and Leila gets twice as many, for every day that Leila is vlogging, Voltaire is only going to get one quarter of the viewers per day.<n>- The money he makes per day equals 2/3*50, which is 33.33 or 33.3. He earned $350.<n>- The money Jim spent equals 10/0.5, which is 20, not $20.<n><n>

The purpose of the final line is not entirely clear and its semantics are somewhat complex. As a rule of thumb, I like to write a final line only in programs where the program's overall structure becomes clear to me while writing it. The final line is particularly unsuited for programs where I am still experimenting with the program's structure.<n><n><a href="https://www.codementor.io/pavan41/basic-oop-java-questions-interview-prep-6oq7mj0xz" target="_blank">https://www.codeamentor.io</a><n><iframe src="https://carrd.co/embed/95fqf9i96c" width="1756" height="504" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" ></iframe><n><n>

If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:Dan outfitted his house to run on the oldest heat source on Earth. What is the oldest heat source on Earth? Choices:  A: fire B: solar energy C: sun D: house E: coal or wood<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you get a question like this it may help to start a flow chart or think of what it means without any other information:<n><n>If "fire": ____<n>If "solar energy": _____<n>If "sun": ______<n>If "house": _________<n>If "coal or wood": ___________<n><n>By trying to figure out what these are you can then add the rest of the clues to it.<n><n>### Input:"Tommy has an ___ more apples than Mike. Mike's apple collection is 2 more than Tommy's. Tommy has ___ apples more than Tommy a day ago. How many apples does Mike have?"<n><n>### Response:"Tommy _____ apples than Mike, Mike's apple collection equals 2 more than Tommy and Tommy has ___ more apples now than Tommy did yesterday. How many apples do Mike have?"<n><n>It's a pretty simple problem. But it helps to think of it with the flowchart instead of having to write all of the information out.<n><n>![image](assets/images/flowchart-thumb.png)<n><n>Then you can use variables to help you with your answer and the last two values in the formula will be the answer with some of the other known variables.<n><n>### Example 2:<n><n>### Input:`Ruth has 30% more books than Mariel. Mary has 2 more books than Ann. Ruth has 1 more book than Mary. How many books does Ann have?`<n><n>### Response:`Ruth has 130% more books, Mary has 8% more, and Ann has 1 more. (You'll need to find out the last number to put it in the formula.) Ann has (1+60%)= 38.`<n><n>The same steps can be used:<n><n>If you use variables to help you, then there's less chance of misreading your own notes, and remembering the information.<n><n># SAT Mathematical Questions with Multiple Choice answers<n><n>### Instructions: Write a response that appropriates completes the request. <n><n>### Deminstration: Input: ________.<n><n>An example follows:<n><n>This is from a practice test we took online. As you can see below, it's a lot of data. I

The items had a combined value of 550.  What could they have been?<n>The four were given one of each of the following; each person received a different kind.<n>a. A toy worth 80, 2 puzzles worth 2, a stuffed animal worth 50, and a coloring book worth 10.<n>b. A necklace worth 60, a board game worth 30, a ring worth $4, a bracelet worth 25 and a book worth 75.<n>c. A teddy bear worth 65, 2 books worth 15, a notebook worth 35, four socks worth 5, and a keychain worth 3.<n>d. Two picture frames worth 10 each, $60 in change, two puzzles worth 10 each and a photo album worth 40.<n><n>### Response	 :<n>The correct answer would be option (c), or (d), as both options (c) and (d) add up to 550. Lily would have gotten the photo album.

Choices:  A: great B: distinguished C: remarkable D: excellent E: peculiar<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: Input A "D"<n><n>### Output:<n><n>Answer:<n>### Input:In a competition between 2 students, the girl who got 2nd place scored 40 less than the student who got 1st place.  How many points did the girl who got 1st get in the competition?<n><n>### Demostration:Input A "60"<n><n>### Input "62" Output: C<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Choose option that is correct.<n><n>### Input A:<n><n>Output:<n><n>### Input B:<n><n>Output: D<n><n>### Input C:<n><n>Output: B<n><n>### Input D:<n><n>Output: C<n><n>## Solution:<n>> 1. What does 124 have in common with the fraction ¹/₃?<n><n>They both can be converted to 42.<n><n>2. Answer:<n>>  A. In the following statements, select all statements that are logically equivalent.<n>   1. If the sum of $4 + $3 + $2 + $1 is equal to $10, then the sum of $6 + $5 + $4 +$3 is also  $10.<n>   2. If $4 \neq 5, then $2 \neq 3.<n>   3. $5 \neq 3$.<n><n>The second and the third statements in the question have one common factor in the statement.<n><n>3.  Answer:<n>> $50 + 15 - 4 = 57$<n><n>4. Answer:<n>> I'm going to answer the question with the number 32, since it's the number of chips in my bucket.<n><n>5. Answer: C<n><n>6. Answer:<n>> The sum of those two expressions is indeed equal to 60.<n><n>7. Input:<n>> "In a classroom, there is one blue box, two green boxes plus 13 orange boxes."<n><n>Output: C)<n><n>8. Input:<n>> The sum is 27<n><n>9. Input:<n>> $10 = 12$<n><n>Output: None of the options<n><n>> These two expressions are equal<n>10. Input:"10 dollars and 125 cents."

Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:A man was driving himself to the airport, where did he put his luggage? Choices:  A: closet B: at hotel C: sidewalk D: bus stop E: trunk<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions:Write the code in python to complete this task<n>* * * * *<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Answer: 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>Input: In a classroom, there are blue chairs, green chairs, and white chairs. There are 10 blue chairs. The green chairs are 3 times as many as the blue chairs, and there are 13 fewer white chairs than the green and blue chairs combined. How many chairs are there in a classroom?<n>Answer: 67<n><n>Input: 4.5 gallons of coffee were divided among 18 thermoses. Genevieve drank 3 thermoses. How many pints of coffee did Genevieve drink?<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: Alannah, Beatrix, and Queen are preparing for the new school year and have been given books by their parents. Alannah has 20 more books than Beatrix. Queen has 1/5 times more books than Alannah. If Beatrix has 30 books, how many books do the three have together?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: A bird eats 7 berries a day. Samuel has 5 birds. How many berries do Samuel's birds eat in 4 days?<n>Answer: 140<n><n>Input: On Blacks, Martha goes to the mall to buy clothes on sale. For every 2 jackets she buys, she gets 1 free jacket. For every 3 t-shirts she buys, she gets 1 free t-shirt. Martha decides to buy 4 jackets and 9 t-shirts. How many clothes will she take home?<n>Answer: 18<n><n>Input: Voltaire and Leila are vloggers, Voltaire has an average of 50 viewers per day while Leila has twice the number of viewers Voltaire has. If they earn $0.50 per view, how much does Leila earn per week?<n>Answer: 350<n><n>Input: Twice the money Jericho has is 60. He owes Annika $14 and also owes half as much to Manny. After paying off all his debts, how much money will Jericho be left with?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: In North Carolina, Jim bought 10 gallons of gas at $2.00/gallon.  He paid $1.00 more per gallon in Virginia where he bought another 10 gallons of gas.  How much has he spent on gas?<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input:If I am forgiving, what hidden force may be activated in my life? Choices:  A: nice feeling B: good karma C: respect D: new freedom E: good heart<n><n>### Response:		<n>- A<n><n>If the word 'forgiving' is linked to 'nice feeling', I can assume that it should be positive. Forgiving is a form of kindness. Kindness is an attribute of a good heart. When someone is kind, the other person will have that nice feeling that he or she wants.<n><n>When you are good, you will always be good. The world will always welcome you back. When you are bad, you will stay bad.<n><n>When I'm kind, I can get into a better heart.<n><n>Kindness will lead me to good karma. In order to make my life become a good life, I must forgive and be forgiving.<n><n>### Answer Key:<n>```<n>A. C<n>B. B<n>C. A<n>D. E<n>E. D<n>F. D<n>```
